title: Chrissy Teigen gets mixed reactions to a new arm tattoo with some saying it has ‘really strong Holocaust vibes’
text:
source Frazer Harrison/Getty Images

Chrissy Teigen posted a photo on her Instagram Thursday night depicting a minimal tattoo with numbers representing five birthdays, three of which include her husband, singer John Legend (12/28/78), her daughter Luna (4/14/16), and her son Miles (5/16/18).

Some accounts praised the simplicity of the tattoo in the comment section, while others speculated who the other two birthdays belonged to.

However, other commenters said that the tattoo resembled the tattoos given to prisoners during the Holocaust as a system of identification. One person commented that the tattoo gave “really strong Holocaust vibes.”

Chrissy Teigen’s new tattoo meant as a sweet tribute to her family was met with controversy Friday after fans pointed out its resemblance to serial numbers tattooed on Holocaust prisoners.

Teigen posted a photo on her Instagram Thursday night as she went under the needle. The series of photos showed a minimal tattoo featuring numbers representing five birthdays, three of which include her husband, singer John Legend (12/28/78), her daughter Luna (4/14/16), and her son Miles (5/16/18).

Legend commented on the photo, saying that the tattoo was the “ultimate mnemonic device.” Actor David Spade joked in the comment section, writing “I use these lotto number too. Small world.” Some accounts praised the simplicity of the tattoo in the comment section, while others speculated who the other two birthdays belonged to.

However, other commenters said that the tattoo resembled the tattoos given to prisoners during the Holocaust as a system of identification. One person commented that the tattoo gave “really strong Holocaust vibes.”

Read more: People got angry at Chrissy Teigen for spoiling ‘The Voice’ winner, and she responded with a backhanded apology

“I think this would make any Jewish person very uncomfortable even if unintentionally,” one user wrote on the Instagram post.

“Is anyone else a little bothered by the fact that she got a series of numbers on her forearm? Is the Holocaust really that far removed from our reality?” another person commented.

One user acknowledged that the relation of the tattoo to the Holocaust was unintentional, but encouraged the star to research more into the history of the event.

“Chrissy, I know you didn’t mean to evoke this with your tattoo, but I encourage you to look up the history of holocaust tattoos – a series of numbers forcibly given to people held in concentration camps to identify them,” the user commented. “This has potential to be very offensive, even if that was not your intention.”

Another commenter noted the generational difference, writing, “Remember when having numbers tattooed on your forearm was not so cool? Times changed. Good.”

Others defended the celebrity: “As a Jewish person who lost family in the Shoah, THIS tattoo is absolutely NOTHING like the numbers which were ground into the skin of millions of people’s arms, Jews and non-Jews alike,” one person wrote. “These numbers appear to be a celebration of life for loved and cherished human beings, not a means to catalogue those considered subhuman and marked for death.”

A representative for Teigen did not immediately respond to Insider’s request for comment.
